metadata.Title: CVE-2019-15847 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - negligible.
metadata.Description: The POWER9 backend in GNU Compiler Collection (GCC) before version 10 could optimize multiple calls of the __builtin_darn intrinsic into a single call, thus reducing the entropy of the random number generator. This occurred because a volatile operation was not specified. For example, within a single execution of a program, the output of every __builtin_darn() call may be the same.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> this is part of the power9 ISA, and Ubuntu binaries are built with the power8 ISA, so no binaries in the archive are affected  setting priority to negligible

criterions.comment: gcc-7 package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
gcc-8 package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
gcc-8-cross package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
gcc-8-cross-ports package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
gcc-9 package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '9.2.1-28ubuntu1').
gcc-9-cross package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
gcc-9-cross-ports package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
gcc-arm-none-eabi package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
gcc-avr package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
gcc-defaults package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
gcc-h8300-hms package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
gcc-m68hc1x package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
gcc-mingw-w64 package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
gcc-msp430 package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
gcc-opt package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
gcc-snapshot package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
